title: Authors and Citation
text: Kenny C (2025). ha: Interact 'Home Assistant'. R package version 0.0.0.9000, http://christophertkenny.com/ha/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ha: Interact with 'Home Assistant'},   author = {Christopher T. Kenny},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {http://christophertkenny.com/ha/}, }

title: Interact with Home Assistant
text: goal ha control smart home using HomeAssistant R session.

title: Interact with Home Assistant
text: can install development version ha GitHub :

title: Interact with Home Assistant
text: First, need allow HomeAssistant use API. can editing config/configuration.yaml file include: , restart HomeAssistant. Get key HomeAssistant UI profile. ios Android device, can create long-lived access token profile page mobile app. done scrolling bottom app, selecting profile, creating new long-lived access token. , setup key. check configured correctly, use simple ha_api() function: , can perform available API calls, states, events, services. example, get states: devices connected, can interact . example, toggle light: (Beware, run network, turns light , let’s turn !)
code: library(ha) api: ha_set_key('YOUR_LONG_LIVED_ACCESS_TOKEN', install = TRUE) ha_api() #> $message #> [1] "API running." ha_get_states()[[1]] #> $entity_id #> [1] "update.home_assistant_supervisor_update" #>  #> $state #> [1] "off" #>  #> $attributes #> $attributes$auto_update #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $attributes$display_precision #> [1] 0 #>  #> $attributes$installed_version #> [1] "2025.08.3" #>  #> $attributes$in_progress #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $attributes$latest_version #> [1] "2025.08.3" #>  #> $attributes$release_summary #> NULL #>  #> $attributes$release_url #> [1] "https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/releases/tag/2025.08.3" #>  #> $attributes$skipped_version #> NULL #>  #> $attributes$title #> [1] "Home Assistant Supervisor" #>  #> $attributes$update_percentage #> NULL #>  #> $attributes$entity_picture #> [1] "https://brands.home-assistant.io/hassio/icon.png" #>  #> $attributes$friendly_name #> [1] "Home Assistant Supervisor Update" #>  #> $attributes$supported_features #> [1] 1 #>  #>  #> $last_changed #> [1] "2025-09-04T01:48:03.742894+00:00" #>  #> $last_reported #> [1] "2025-09-04T01:48:03.742894+00:00" #>  #> $last_updated #> [1] "2025-09-04T01:48:03.742894+00:00" #>  #> $context #> $context$id #> [1] "01K496HMRY33DK2278FNP0Y8PX" #>  #> $context$parent_id #> NULL #>  #> $context$user_id #> NULL ha_set_services('light', 'turn_on', entity_id = 'light.h6076') #> [[1]] #> [[1]]$entity_id #> [1] "light.h6076" #>  #> [[1]]$state #> [1] "on" #>  #> [[1]]$attributes #> [[1]]$attributes$min_color_temp_kelvin #> [1] 2000 #>  #> [[1]]$attributes$max_color_temp_kelvin #> [1] 9000 #>  #> [[1]]$attributes$min_mireds #> [1] 111 #>  #> [[1]]$attributes$max_mireds #> [1] what: Mapping of functions to API endpoints
title: Interact with Home Assistant
text: full list API endpoints descriptions available . ha_api():get /api/` ha_get_config(): get /api/config ha_get_events(): get /api/events ha_get_services(): get /api/services ha_get_history(): get /api/history/period/<timestamp> ha_get_logbook(): get /api/logbook/<timestamp> ha_get_states(): get /api/states ha_get_states(entity_id=): get /api/states/<entity_id> ha_get_error_log(): get /api/error_log TBD: get /api/camera_proxy/<camera entity_id> ha_get_calendars(): get /api/calendars TBD: get /api/calendars/<calendar entity_id>?start=<timestamp>&end=<timestamp> ha_set_states(): post /api/states/<entity_id> ha_set_event(): post /api/events/<event_type> ha_set_service(): post /api/services/<domain>/<service> ha_render_template(): post /api/template ha_check_config(): post /api/config/core/check_config ha_set_intent(): post /api/intent/handle ha_delete_states():delete /api/states/`

title: ha: Interact with 'Home Assistant' — ha-package
text: Provides tools control smart home features via API 'Home Assistant' https://developers.home-assistant.io/. Allows controlling states, services, events. Supports configuring local access remote access.

what: Check if the API is running — ha_api
title: Check if the API is running — ha_api
Check if the API is running — ha_api
Check if the API is running — ha_api
text: ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

title: Check if the API is running — ha_api
Check if the API is running — ha_api

what: Get Home Assistant configuration validity — ha_check_config
title: Get Home Assistant configuration validity — ha_check_config
Get Home Assistant configuration validity — ha_check_config
Get Home Assistant configuration validity — ha_check_config
text: ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

title: Get Home Assistant configuration validity — ha_check_config
text: list containing Home Assistant configuration check result.

title: Get Home Assistant configuration validity — ha_check_config
Remove Home Assistant State — ha_delete_states
text: entity_id Entity ID. example, sensor.temperature. ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

title: Retrieve Home Assistant calendar — ha_get_calendars
text: ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

title: Retrieve Home Assistant Configuration — ha_get_config
text: ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

what: Retrieve Home Assistant Error Log — ha_get_error_log
title: Retrieve Home Assistant Error Log — ha_get_error_log
Retrieve Home Assistant Error Log — ha_get_error_log
Retrieve Home Assistant Error Log — ha_get_error_log
text: ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

title: Retrieve Home Assistant Error Log — ha_get_error_log
text: list containing Home Assistant error log

title: Retrieve Home Assistant Error Log — ha_get_error_log
Retrieve Home Assistant Events — ha_get_events
text: ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

title: Retrieve Home Assistant History — ha_get_history
text: entity_id Required. Entity ID. example, sensor.temperature. timestamp Optional. Time YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD format. ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

what: Retrieve Home Assistant Logbook Entries — ha_get_logbook
title: Retrieve Home Assistant Logbook Entries — ha_get_logbook
Retrieve Home Assistant Logbook Entries — ha_get_logbook
Retrieve Home Assistant Logbook Entries — ha_get_logbook
text: timestamp Optional. Time YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD format. ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

title: Retrieve Home Assistant Logbook Entries — ha_get_logbook
Retrieve Home Assistant Logbook Entries — ha_get_logbook
Retrieve Home Assistant Services — ha_get_services
text: ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

title: Retrieve Home Assistant States — ha_get_states
text: entity_id Optional. Entity ID. example, sensor.temperature. ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

what: Render a Home Assistant Template — ha_render_template
title: Render a Home Assistant Template — ha_render_template
Render a Home Assistant Template — ha_render_template
Render a Home Assistant Template — ha_render_template
text: template length one character vector containing template render. ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

title: Render a Home Assistant Template — ha_render_template
text: length one character vector containing rendered template

title: Render a Home Assistant Template — ha_render_template
code: if (FALSE) { # ha_has_key() ha_render_template("My living room light is {{ states('light.h6076') }}.") }

title: Set Home Assistant Events — ha_set_event
text: event_type type event set, e.g. light.turn_on event_data Optional. named list data send event. ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

title: Set Home Assistant Events — ha_set_event
text: vector events fired confirmation detailed information

title: Set Home Assistant Intents — ha_set_intent
text: Note requires use "intents" Home Assistant, enabled default. Using without enabling create error.

title: Set Home Assistant Intents — ha_set_intent
text: intent intent fire ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

title: Add Entry to Renviron — ha_set_key
code: ha_set_key(key, overwrite = FALSE, install = FALSE, r_env = NULL)

title: Add Entry to Renviron — ha_set_key
text: key Character. API key add add. overwrite Defaults FALSE. Boolean. existing FELT_KEY Renviron overwritten? install Defaults FALSE. Boolean. added environment file, r_env? r_env Path install install TRUE.

title: Add Entry to Renviron — ha_set_key
code: example_env <- tempfile(fileext = '.Renviron') ha_set_key('EXAMPLE-1234', r_env = example_env) #> Example key. Returning without setting. # r_env should likely be: file.path(Sys.getenv('HOME'), '.Renviron')

title: Set Home Assistant Services — ha_set_services
text: domain entity domain. example, light switch. service service name. example, turn_on turn_off. entity_id Entity ID. example, sensor.temperature. ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

title: Set Home Assistant State — ha_set_states
code: ha_set_states(entity_id, state, attributes = NULL, ip = NULL)

title: Set Home Assistant State — ha_set_states
text: entity_id Entity ID. example, sensor.temperature. state state value. example, . attributes Optional. named list attributes set entity. ip IP address. Default NULL, uses local host.

title: Set Home Assistant State — ha_set_states
code: if (FALSE) { # ha_has_key() ha_set_states(entity_id = 'rpkg.test', state = 'on',   attributes = list(version = '4.5.1')) }
